Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ocellatin-3N (OCN-3N; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: Skin Secretions, the Caribbean frog,Leptodactylus nesiotus, South America

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (55%) tofrog Citropin 1.1.3.Activity: Active against antibiotic-resistant K. pneumoniae ATCC 49472 or ATCC BAA-2814 (MIC 62.5 uM) and reference strains of E. coli ATCC 35218 (MIC 31.25 uM),  P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853  (MIC 62.5 uM),  S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 62.5 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 12600 or ATCC 25923 or ATCC BAA-2312 (MIC 12.5-31.25 uM), E. faecium ATCC 19434 (MIC 62.5 uM), and E.faecalis ATCC 51299 (MIC 250 uM). Also, active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 6.25 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 25 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 6.25 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 12.5 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 6.25 uM), B. megaterium BM11 (MIC 0.78 uM), and a strain of the major emerging
yeast pathogen C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 (MIC 25 uM) (Conlon et al., 2022.Toxicity: moderate Hemolytic HC50 = 98 uM.SAR: Synthetic derivatives available in the APD.Updated 4/2025
Literature Information.Author: Barran G, Kolodziejek J, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Nowotny N, Conlon JM, Mechkarska M. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Peptidomic Analysis of Skin Secretions of the Caribbean Frogs Leptodactylus insularum and Leptodactylus nesiotus (Leptodactylidae) Identifies an Ocellatin with Broad Spectrum Antimicrobial Activity
